alert.note: Alert for Eastern Dutchess; Eastern Ulster; Western Dutchess (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 19 at 2:16PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT PARTS OF EASTERN DUTCHESS...WESTERN DUTCHESS...AND EASTERN ULSTER COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A snow squall which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 216 PM EST, a snow squall was along a line extending from near Port Ewen to near Plattekill and moving east at 40 MPH. THIS SQUALL WILL BE NEAR... Hyde Park and Staatsburg around 220 PM EST. Beacon, Wappingers Falls and Marlboro around 225 PM EST. Pleasant Valley, Fishkill and Myers Corner around 230 PM EST. Hopewell Junction around 235 PM EST. Millbrook around 240 PM EST. Dover Plains around 250 PM EST. This includes Interstate 87 near exit 18. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&

area.areaDesc: Eastern Dutchess; Eastern Ulster; Western Dutchess
